thread.title: Fiorina Slams Hillary Clinton’s “First Woman” Campaign Strategy
thread.title_full: Fiorina Slams Hillary Clinton’s “First Woman” Campaign Strategy | Opinion - Conservative

author: beforeitsnews.com
title: Fiorina Slams Hillary Clinton’s “First Woman” Campaign Strategy
text:
(Before It's News)
While Donald Trump is making all the news with his upcoming rallies in Jacksonville and Miami this coming weekend, another Republican presidential candidate, Carly Fiorina, took to the stage in Hernando County to tell Republicans that she is no running for president just because she is a woman.
The remark was an obvious slight against Democratic presidential candidate Hillary Clinton, whose entire campaign seems to be anchored on the fact that she is a woman seeking the presidency.
“She’s not really running on her track record, and the positions that she has taken in this campaign are quite recent. But she reminded us over and over and over again in that debate that she’s an outsider because she would be the first woman.”- Carly Fiorina
Fiorina added:
“Let me start by assuring you that I will never ask for your vote because I’m a woman…I’m very proud of being a woman but I’m going to ask for your support because I believe I’m the most qualified candidate to win this job and the most qualified candidate to do this job.”
More Fiorina:
“I am running for president of the United States ladies and gentleman because I think we have reached a critical point where the possibilities for too many Americans, indeed the potential of this great nation, is being crushed by a government that has grown so big, so powerful, so costly, so inept, so complicated, and yes, so corrupt – and a professional political class that refuses to do anything about it.”
You can read more about Carly Fiorina here , as well as listen to a recent phone interview she did with us a couple months back.
